p: Clevenger apparatus was used to extract the essential oil from the air-dried aboveground parts of each sample in three replications. According to the European Pharmacopoeia, 30 g each of the drug plants from the Lamiaceae family ( S. kitaibelii, T. serpyllum and O. vulgare ssp. vulgare) and 400 mL of water and 20 g each of cut drug from the Asteraceae family ( A. millefolium and A. clypeolata) and 500 mL of water were placed separately in 1000 mL round bottom flasks and distilled for 3 h [ 100].
